intro: Acronia pseudopogon, commonly known as the false beard lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Trapeliaceae. It is characterized by its foliose thallus, which is typically dark green to black in color, with a distinctive white or pale margin. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a green alga, which allows it to thrive in humid, shaded environments. It is often found on tree trunks and rocks in temperate regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to lichenologists and conservationists.
